entries.title: Trudeau Eyes Billions to Patch Canada’s Creaking Health System
entries.description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is preparing to commit billions of dollars to help shore up a strained health-care system, opening the spending taps for a service that many Canadians say isn’t working well.

entries.title: US Plans 200% Tariff on Russia Aluminum as Soon as This Week
entries.description: The US is preparing to impose a 200% tariff on Russian-made aluminum as soon as this week to keep pressure on Moscow as the one-year anniversary of the invasion of Ukraine nears, according to people familiar with the situation.

entries.title: Burkina Faso Junta to Strengthen Control Over Mining Sector
entries.description: Burkina Faso’s military rulers are seeking to process more of its gold locally to ensure control over the country’s main source of revenue following a drop in output.

entries.title: Russia’s Lavrov In Africa Yet Again to Ease Diplomatic Isolation
entries.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov returned to Africa Monday for the second time in 10 days as the long-serving top diplomat focuses on the region amid a scarcity of international contacts since the Kremlin’s invasion of Ukraine.

entries.title: Israel’s Top Central Banker Evokes Economy in Courts Debate
entries.description: Israel’s central bank governor waded carefully into a debate over government plans to revamp the country’s legal system, saying that “strong and independent institutions” were essential for a prosperous and developed economy.

entries.title: Senate Won’t Be Able to Do Much — Even With a Full Agenda
entries.description: It’s a tough time to be a US senator.

entries.title: Nigerian Senator Exploited Street Trader for His Kidney, Jury Told
entries.description: A Nigerian politician was accused of bringing a Lagos street trader to the UK in order to harvest one of the man’s organs to help his sick daughter.

entries.title: China Balloon Saga Spotlights Beijing’s Global Surveillance Push
entries.description: The high-profile spectacle of an alleged Chinese surveillance balloon flying over the continental US is shining a spotlight on the prevalence of similar incidents around the world, from Taipei to Latin America.

entries.title: Truss Made ‘Unforced Error’ Over Tax Cuts, Top Lawmaker Says
entries.description: Liz Truss’s government made an “unforced error” by announcing sweeping tax cuts cuts last year that spooked markets, according to the head of the UK’s Treasury Select Committee.

entries.title: Norway’s Leader Proposes $7.3 Billion for War-Scarred Ukraine
entries.description: Norway is considering spending 75 billion kroner ($7.3 billion) over the next five years on assistance for Ukraine, ravaged by the Russian invasion.

entries.title: Over 1,000 Dead in Twin Earthquakes That Shook Southeast Turkey
entries.description: Turkish authorities said over a thousand people were killed in two massive earthquakes that hit the country’s southeastern region on Monday.

entries.title: French Pension Debate to Start in Parliament as New Strikes Loom
entries.description: France’s National Assembly will start debating French President Emmanuel Macron’s pension reform bill on Monday as unions gear up for two more days of strikes and protests against the plan this week.

entries.title: Russia Sends More Oil by Sea, But Kremlin’s War Chest Pressured
entries.description: Russia's crude flows rose to the highest since June, but cash for Moscow’s coffers is undermined by deep discounts

entries.title: Brexit Is Making Inflation Worse for the UK, BOE Official Says
entries.description: Bank of England policy maker Catherine Mann waded into the Brexit debate, blaming UK’s departure from the European Union for adding to inflation.

entries.title: Six Lessons From the US-China Balloon Spat
entries.description: What the US says was a spy balloon and what China says was a weather craft sent off course by strong wind has sparked fresh tensions between the two powers.

entries.title: New South African Lawmakers Sworn in Ahead of Cabinet Revamp
entries.description: Paul Mashatile, the new deputy president of South Africa’s governing party, was appointed as a lawmaker on Monday, a likely precursor to him taking up the No. 2 post in the government.

entries.title: Some Brexiteers Will Admit EU Exit Is a ‘Disaster,’ Amber Rudd Says
entries.description: Former home secretary Amber Rudd has claimed that some Brexiteers, after "a drink or two", will admit that the decision to leave the EU has been a "disaster".

entries.title: Turkey’s South Hit by a Second High-Magnitude Earthquake
entries.description: Turkey on Monday reported a second massive earthquake in the southeast of the country in less than 12 hours.

entries.title: What’s Become of Ghosn as Nissan and Renault Revamp Alliance?
entries.description: The alliance forged by Carlos Ghosn between Renault SA and Nissan Motor Co. is being revamped as the carmakers chart separate paths, an outcome set in motion by his arrest on charges of financial misconduct four years ago. After serving two lengthy stints in jail before being released on bail, Ghosn slipped out of the country in late 2019 and found sanctuary in Lebanon, where he has citizenship. He has professed his innocence and said the deck had been stacked against him. While the carmakers ar

entries.title: China Lets Online Criticism of US Rip Over Balloon Dispute
entries.description: China’s internet was silent for much of Friday, when the US’s spy balloon claims started consuming global social media. But the criticism suddenly began to flow after Beijing weighed in.

entries.title: China Says Balloon Over Latin America Was Also Blown Off Course
entries.description: China said a balloon that the Pentagon spotted over Latin America was blown off course, echoing an explanation for a vehicle seen over US military sites that the Biden administration has rejected.

entries.title: Turkey Declines Musk’s Offer to Send Starlink After Deadly Quake
entries.description: The Turkish government declined Elon Musk’s proposal to send a satellite broadband service to the country after the strongest earthquake to hit the country in decades.

entries.title: UN Peacekeeper Killed in Congo after Regional Leaders Meet
entries.description: A United Nations peacekeeper died and another was seriously wounded after their helicopter was shot at in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo on Sunday, a day after East African Community leaders met to steady a flailing peace process.

entries.title: South Africa Nears an Ignoble Record: 100 Days of Blackouts
entries.description: South Africa is nearing 100 consecutive days of rolling blackouts, the longest stretch yet, with more to come as its electricity crisis deepens.

entries.title: Israel to Provide Rapid Aid to Turkey After Deadly Earthquake
entries.description: Israel Foreign Minister Eli Cohen instructed his office to lead a rapid aid program for Turkey following an earthquake that killed scores of people in Turkey and Syria and trapped hundreds more.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: Zelenskiy Sanctions Russia’s Nuclear Sector
entries.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy signed a decree imposing sanctions against Russia’s nuclear industry, including state company Rosatom, and said the penalties should bolster Ukraine’s calls for global restrictions on the sector.

entries.title: Modi Comes Under India Opposition Fire Over Adani Links
entries.description: India’s parliament has adjourned for a third day as the opposition piled on more pressure on Prime Minister Narendra Modi, highlighting his ties to tycoon Gautam Adani and the risks to millions of small investors due to state-owned institutions’ exposure to the billionaire’s companies.

entries.title: Singapore Defends Lack of Charges in $55 Million Bribery Case
entries.description: Singapore’s government defended a decision not to prosecute key figures at Keppel Offshore & Marine Ltd. over a major bribery case involving payments to Brazil’s state-run energy company.

entries.title: Record UK Health-Care Strike Piles Pressure on Stretched Service
entries.description: Health care workers will walk out in record numbers this week, crippling the National Health Service and piling pressure on Prime Minister Rishi Sunak to resolve multiple disputes over pay for public-sector workers.

entries.title: In Pictures: Major Earthquake Collapses Buildings in Turkey, Syria
entries.description: A major earthquake has struck Turkey and Syria, knocking down entire buildings and trapping people under huge piles of rubble. Authorities fear the death toll will be high.

entries.title: Japan PM Kishida Apologizes for Aide’s Anti-LGBT Comments
entries.description: Japan Prime Minister Fumio Kishida apologized for discriminatory comments made by one of his aides last week, reiterating the government’s policy of “respecting diversity and creating an inclusive society.”

entries.title: Australia, China Trade Ministers Hold First Talks Since 2019
entries.description: China and Australia’s top trade officials are meeting for the first time since 2019, the latest sign of a warming in diplomatic relations between the two countries.

entries.title: Harry Whittington, Shot by Cheney in Hunting Mishap, Dies at 95
entries.description: Harry Whittington, the attorney from Texas who survived a hunting accident in 2006 when then-US Vice President Dick Cheney shot him in the face while tracking a passing bird, has died. He was 95.

entries.title: China Weather Bureau Shake-Up Draws Scrutiny After Balloon Furor
entries.description: China replaced its national weather chief just after the US revealed the balloon was flying over its territory, fueling speculation that the move was connected to Beijing’s claim it was a climate research vehicle.

entries.title: US Didn’t Know About Chinese Balloons During Trump Until Later
entries.description: Chinese surveillance balloons flew over the continental United States at least three times during the Trump years, according to a senior administration official, but their incursions weren’t discovered until after Joe Biden took office.

entries.title: 7.8-Magnitude Quake Collapses Buildings in Central Turkey
entries.description: ANKARA, Turkey (AP) — A 7.8 magnitude quake has knocked down multiple buildings in southeast Turkey and Syria and many casualties are feared.

entries.title: Magnitude 7.7 Earthquake Strikes in Turkey
entries.description: A magnitude 7.7 earthquake struck at a depth of 10 kilometers (6.2 miles) and had an epicenter near the town of Gaziantep, according to a report from GFZ Helmholtz Centre Potsdam.

entries.title: British Gas Ordered by Regulator to Halt Pre-Payment Warrants
entries.description: The UK’s energy regulator issued a legal order demanding that British Gas stop using court warrants to force the installation of pre-payment meters in people’s homes.

entries.title: IMF Head Warns American Consumers Would Suffer If US Defaulted
entries.description: A US debt default would cause a spike in borrowing costs that squeezes American consumers as well as significant harm to the world economy, International Monetary Fund Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said.
